name: Legal Aid of Wyoming
address: Multiple offices across Wyoming, including Cheyenne (administrative), Casper, Lander, Gillette, Rock Springs, and Cody
description: A statewide, non-profit law firm providing free civil legal assistance to low-income individuals in Wyoming. They also have a tribal advocate for members of the Wind River Indian Reservation
services: Disabled-owned Legal aid in Wyoming consultation

name: Protection & Advocacy System, Inc. (P&A)
address: Not specified in search results, but operates statewide in Wyoming
phone: (307) 766-2761 (Wyoming Institute for Disabilities, a network partner)
description: A federally funded non-profit corporation that protects the human, civil, and legal rights of people with disabilities in Wyoming. They provide legal representation, advocacy, education, and information services
services: Disabled-owned Legal aid in Wyoming consultation

name: Equal Justice Wyoming
address: Not specified in search results, but operates statewide
description: Connects eligible Wyoming residents with legal resources and coordinates a network of legal aid providers and pro bono attorneys. They also offer resources for individuals representing themselves in court
services: Disabled-owned Legal aid in Wyoming consultation

name: University of Wyoming College of Law Legal Clinics
address: Laramie, WY (specific building not detailed in search)
phone: (307) 766-6416 (General clinic line, specific clinics may have different numbers)
description: Offers various clinics, including the Civil Legal Services Clinic, which assists clients with issues related to federal assistance benefits, housing, and disability rights

name: Wyoming Children's Law Center, Inc. (WCLC)
address: Not specified in search results, but operates statewide

name: Teton County Access to Justice Center (TCATJC)
address: Teton County, WY (specific address not detailed in search)
description: A self-help resource center offering free legal services to income-qualified individuals in Teton, Sublette, and Lincoln counties

name: Wyoming Coalition Against Domestic Violence and Sexual Assault
description: Represents low-income victims of domestic violence, sexual assault, dating violence, and stalking, providing legal services in areas such as family law and housing

name: DarrasLaw
description: Specializes in disability insurance claims and appeals for individuals in Wyoming and nationwide. They assist with claims, appeals, and litigation

name: Dabdoub Law Firm
address: Serves clients across the country, including Wyoming
description: Focuses exclusively on disability insurance law, assisting with claims, appeals, and litigation, including ERISA-governed claims

name: Wyoming Institute for Disabilities (WIND)
address: 1000 E. University of Wyoming, Dept. 4298, Laramie, WY 82071
description: Part of the national network of University Centers for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities (UCEDD), WIND works to assist individuals with developmental disabilities and their families through education, training, and community services.
